term.title: azinic acids

item.text: Derivatives of the parent structure H2N+(O−)OH, of which the alkylidene derivatives, R2C=N+(O−)OH (tautomers of nitroalkanes), are the most commonly encountered. The alkylideneazinic acids are known as nitronic acids, or synonymously as aci-nitro compounds, e.g. CH2=N+(O−)OH methylideneazinic acid.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 1307. 'Glossary of class names of organic compounds and reactivity intermediates based on structure (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 1321 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567081307)
